Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You make sure to get us as close as you can, okay? If it's a good trip, I'll give you a little extra.

Speaker: enrique
Dialogue: Don't worry. I take you close. But not too close.  You don't want them to eat you.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: What was that?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Unclip your line!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Oh, actually, Charlie, those two are herbivores. They wouldn't be interested in fighting each other. But these...  See, these are carnivores. And this one here -- see its claws -- this one here uses its claws to gouge at the throat of its opponent

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Uh, Alan?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Hmm?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: He's three. Why don't you wait till he's a little older?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Oh, right.  Happy dinosaurs.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: That must be Mark.  Mark, were back here!

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Keeping the world safe.  Here, let me take her.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Mark, this is Alan Grant.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Nice to meet you, Alan. I've heard a lot about you.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Daddy, this is a herbabore.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: What's my name? Come on, Jack, say it. Is my name Alan? Say my name.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Sorry, Alan it's been six years.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: More coffee?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Yes. Great.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Really?  What do you do there?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I could tell you about it, but than I'd have to kill you.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Indeed.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: So what are you working on now?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Anything good?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Raptors, mostly.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: My favorite.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: You remember the sounds they made?

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: I try not to.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: We've done cranial scans, and raptors actually had a quite sophisticated resonating chamber. I have a theory that their ability to vocalize is the key to their social intelligence. The way they can work together as a team.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: You think they could talk to each other?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: To a degree we never imagined.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Bullshit!

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: You taught him that.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Good luck with the fund raising.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: It was never easy, but before Jurassic Park, you could find money. Somewhere. Now fossils are out. Everyone wants to see a real live dinosaur.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Times change Alan. But you're the still the best. I mean that.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: The last of my breed.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Let me know if I can help, Alan. Youre bad about asking for help, but please ask me. Anything, anytime.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Okay. Goodbye, Ellie.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Goodbye, Alan.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: A well-accepted theory.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Alan don't be afraid to evolve.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: It's through the painstaking study of the Interior chamber in multiple specimens that we can determine this exciting correlation between the larynx and the upper plate. That lets us theorize -- theorize, mind you -- that the raptor might have been capable of bird- like vocalizations. Which as you can imagine, would be a tremendous breakthrough.

Speaker: sympostium leader
Dialogue: Thank you very much Dr. Grant. Now does anyone have a question?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Does anyone have a question that doesn't relate to Jurassic Park?

Speaker: male student
Dialogue: Your theory on raptors is good and all, but isn't all this conjecture kind of moot?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: No, and let me be perfectly clear on this point. Dinosaurs lived 65 million years ago. What's left of them is fossilized in stone the actual scientists spend years to undercover.

Speaker: another student
Dialogue: You're saying you wouldn't want to study them if you had the chance?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: No force on this earth or in heaven could get me on that island.

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: Udesky.  Yes sir. we're good to go. I'll lock it down as soon as you drop me the payment.

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: That's right, two of the very best I could find. No, I haven't worked with them personally, but they come with the highest recommendations.

Speaker: cheryl
Dialogue: Billy? I don't think I'm doing this right.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: You need to go slowly. See, just take it little at a time.

Speaker: cheryl
Dialogue: I can never tell what's bone and what's rock.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Technically, it's all rock. The calcium in the bones is replaced during fossilization. But you can feel the difference. See? Rough, smooth. Rough, smooth.

Speaker: cheryl
Dialogue: Rough.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Dr. Grant!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Mr. Brennan.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: How was your trip? Profitable?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: We'll be broke in four weeks.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Three weeks. I had to rent some equipment.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: You rented an automated litter box.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: It's a rapid prototyper. I feed in the scan data from the raptor skull, than the computer breaks it into thousands of slices which this thing prints, one layer on top of the other. It's the future of paleontology.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Not if it can't dig.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I give you a raptor's resonating chamber.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I guarantee it'll be worth your while.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: It's be my pleasure.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: First off let me say as a dinosaur enthusiasts, Amanda and I have admired your work for years.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: It is truly, whats the word? Inspiring.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Amanda and I, well, we just love the outdoors. Heck we've been on pretty much any adventure tour they can come up with: Galapagos, K2, the Nile...

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: We even have two seats reserved aboard the first commercial moon flight.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Hmmm.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Now, for our wedding anniversary this year we wanted to do something really special, something...

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: ...once-in-a-lifetime.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: We've arranged for a private airplane to take us flying over Isla Sorna. And we want you to be our guide.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: That's a very nice offer, Mr. Kirby, but I'm afraid I'm much to busy. If you like I can refer you to a number of highly qualified...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: No, no, see Dr. Grant, you're the best. You've seen these animals in the flesh. No one else has come close to you.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: I'm flattered, but I've taken this little adventure tour. And with the air restrictions they've imposed after the incident in San Diego, you cant fly low enough to see anything of interest.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: You see, that's just the thing. Paul and I have special permission to fly low.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: How low?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Well, I'm no aviation specialist. But I do know it's hell of a lot lower than anyone else.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: From what I understand, it's pretty much whatever we want.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: That's hard to believe.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Let's just say that through my business -- imports/exports, emerging markets -- I've made some friends in high places. In this case, the Costa Rican government.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Dr. Grant, you don't know how important it is for us to have you come along. It would make all the difference.

Speaker: pual
Dialogue: And of course, we're prepared to make a sizeable contribution to your research here.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Even with what I pay you, you could get a better bag.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: No way. This is lucky. Couple years ago some buddies and I went hang gliding off these cliffs in New Zealand. Updraft sent me right into the side. BOOM!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: That does sound lucky.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: It was this strap alone that saved my life. Got caught on a rock as I was falling.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Reverse-Darwinism. Survival of the most idiotic.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Listen Alan, I really appreciate you bringing me along.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: The bones will be there when we get back. That's the nice thing about them. They never run away.  And besides, you got me into this. I don't intend to be alone with these people.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: So how do you know the Kirby's?

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Through our church.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: What Religion?

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Uhthe one that worships God and believes in being Good.

Speaker: raptor
Dialogue: Alan.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Alan. We're almost there.

Speaker: radio voice
Dialogue: Unidentified aircraft approaching Isla Sorna, this is San Juan approach. You are flying in restricted airspace. Immediately turn to the coordinates two-zero-zero. I repeat redirect to...

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: Cooper! Yell up if you see anything!

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: No, I thought I'd keep it to myself.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: There. There! An Apatosaur. Look at the coloration.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I'm so use to seeing bones. It's weird to see skin.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Mr. and Mrs. Kirby! If you look out the right you can see...

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: South shore is clear. The rest is rock.

Speaker: nash
Dialogue: Are we on?

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: We're on.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: That's not the landing gear?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Dr. Grant if you'd just sit tight, we'll explain this all in a jiffy.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: This plane can not land!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: It's going to be all right. Just...

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Eric! Eric! Are you there honey? Ben! Erriccc!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Tell me we didn't land.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I think they're looking for someone.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Dr. Grant, are you alright? I'm sorry we had to be so...

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: What the hell is going on? What are they doing?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Establishing a perimeter. Making it safe. These guys are really good. One of them was a Green...

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Mr. Kirby, trust me, on this island, there is no such thing as safe. We have to get back in this plane...

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: ERRR-IIIC!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: And tell your wife to stop making so much noise! We're food to these damn animals.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Amanda, Honey! Dr. Grant says it's a bad idea!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: He says it's a bad idea!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: What's a bad idea?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What was that?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Is it a rex?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: We gotta go, now!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What's the problem? Can't you guys...?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: We can't just...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Don't worry, honey. We'll circle around and come back.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: What about the other guy?

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: Coop's a professional. He can handle himself.

Speaker: nash
Dialogue: We're going!

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Come on, Nash. Slow down, buddy.

Speaker: nash
Dialogue: Coop, you know I can't do it pal.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What are you doing? That's Mr. Cooper!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Oh, my God! Paul, my God!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Is anyone hurt?

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: Quiet! We're okay. Let's everybody just stay put.

Speaker: nash
Dialogue: Who's got the sat-phone?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Right here!

Speaker: recorded voice
Dialogue: We're sorry. All circuits are busy. Please try your call again later...

Speaker: nash
Dialogue: Shit!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What is it? What's the matter?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Over here!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: This way!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Don't worry. It's dead.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Come on!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Why did you bring us here?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Our son is on this island. We need your help to find him.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: This is him. Eric. Hes thirteen now. He's just about the greatest kid in the world.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: He's with a man named Ben Hildebrand.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Who's that?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Her new boyfriend.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: A friend. We were vacationing. Eric wanted to see the island and the dinosaurs, so Ben found a guy who would take them parasailing. They never came back.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: We called everyone, did everything we could. Because of all the controversy over this island, no one will step in. Costa Rica says it's a no-fly zone, it's their own damn fault. Guys at the U.S Embassy -- our U.S. Embassy -- said we should "accept the inevitable." You believe that?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: So you hired these mercenaries.

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: We prefer "recovery specialists." We do overseas custody issues and...

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Then you duped us into coming here.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: We needed somebody who knew the lay of the land. Somebody who'd been to this island before.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: I have never been on this island!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Sure you have. You wrote that book...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: That was Isla Nublar. This is Isla Sorna. The second island.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I didn't know, there were two islands.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Still, you have survived the dinosaurs before. You saved those kids.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: A few of us survived. A lot more died. And we were better prepared and better armed.  How many days have they been missing?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Eight weeks.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: After what you've seen today, you really think your son could be alive?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: He's smart, Dr. Grant. And he knows so much about dinosaurs.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: No, I'm sorry, but no. We'll savage what we can from the plane. Then we head for the coast. There may be a boat left, something to get us off this island.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Dr. Grant, we're not leaving without our son.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: You can stick with us, or you can go and look for him. Either way you're probably not getting out of here alive.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What do we do?

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: Well, I think we should start searching for your son. In the direction they're going.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Excellent.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Nothing you haven't seen before.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Twenty, twenty-fire pounds. I've been swimming at the Y.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: You hate to swim.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: People change.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: So do you.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: How would you classify it?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Obviously a superpredator.  Suchimimus. that snout.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: They never got that big.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Baryonyx?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Not with that sail.  Spinosaurus Aegypticus.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I don't remember that on InGen's list.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: That's because it wasn't on their list. Who knows what else they were up to?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: So Mr. Kirby, tell me, when you climbed K2, did you base camp at 25- or 30,000 feet?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Thirty-thousand, I think. Closer to the top.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: About a thousand feet above it, actually.  Most mountain-climbers remember how tall that mountains were.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: There is no Kirby Enterprises, is there?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: There is. I own a place called Kirby Paint and Title Plus. We're out in the Westgate Shopping Center in Enid, Oklahoma. The "plus" is for bathroom fixtures, fireplaces accessories, patio furniture. Stuff like that.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I don't suppose that check you wrote us is any good.

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: He paid us half up front. Cash.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Mortgaged everything we had to do it. Even the store. and if we make it off this island with my son, I swear, I'll make good on the money I owe you. I don't care if it takes me the rest of my life.

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: However long that is.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Eric!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Quiet!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Stop that. Dr. Grant says this is dangerous territory.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Well we should split up or something. We can cover twice the area.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: No, Dr. Grant says...

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Dr. Grant says this, Dr. Grant says that...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Well what's the use of hiring an expert if your not going to listen to him?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Because "Dr. Grant" isn't looking for Eric. Dr. Grant is looking for the coast.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Fine...and when the Tricyclatops comes after you, don't come crying to me.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Oh, don't worry about that.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What did you say?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What did you say!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Just drop it Paul!

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: If they split up, I'm going with you.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Young adult.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Eric...

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: That's Ben's!

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: Here, give that to me.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: It looks intact.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: We should take it with us to signal any planes.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: It works!

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: I don't know for how long.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Ben!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Unclip the line!

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: I don't know. I think so.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: We're okay. It's going to be okay. Here, get ready. I'm going to unhook you.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: I'm all right

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: See? He's okay. He's alive! Everything's going to be all right now.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I'm sorry Amanda. I am. And I'm sorry for the things I said about him.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: No, it's...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I know you liked Ben. I had no right to...

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Its not about him. It's Eric. He's alone out here somewhere. Our baby is all alone.

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: Dr. Grant!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Raptors.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Whats a raptor?

Speaker: udesky
Dialogue: They don't look that big. I mean, comparatively.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: If we came across one, we might live.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Well that's good.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: But you never came across just one.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Wait! Where's Billy?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: I thought we weren't suppose to yell.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Ah yes, the first rule of academics. Publish or perish.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I bet there's a very good chance Eric's in there. I'd bet my bottom dollar.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Eric! Are you here?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Eric!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Let's see. I've got about a dollar seventy- five. How about you guys?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Thank God for preservatives.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: This is how you make dinosaurs?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: This is how you play God.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Okay if I take pictures?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Amanda!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Back out! Move!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: In here!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Push!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: She's calling for help.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Head for the trees!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: ALAN!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: KEEP GOING!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Udesky.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: He's this way.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: It's not safe.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: We have to help him.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: He's right. A predator wouldn't leave a kill wounded.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: He's not a kill, he's still alive.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: They couldnt climb up, so they were trying to get us to come down.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: They set a trap  They actually set a trap.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Where's Grant?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: What does that mean? What are you saying?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Come on! They'll be back!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Eric...

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: In Costa Rica?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: On the island.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: They'll never make it. I mean, they can't manage when the cable goes out.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: You'd be surprised what people can do when they have too.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: You're Alan Grant, aren't you?  I read both of your books.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Which one do you prefer?

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: The first one. Before you where on the island. You liked dinosaurs back then.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Back then, they hadn't tried to eat me.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: When InGen cleared out, they left a lot of stuff behind.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Any weapons, radios?

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Found this, but the battery's dead.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: It's a wonder you aren't. I'm amazed, Eric. I barely lasted 30 hours. You lasted eight weeks.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Is that all it's been? I thought it was longer.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: The important thing is we both made it. That's something we have in common.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: What did you think?

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: I dunno. I mean, it was kind of preachy. Chaos-this, chaos-that. And like, to me, the guy seemed kind of high on himself.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: That's two things we have in common.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: We can't just stop looking. Eric and Dr. Grant are out there somewhere.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I want to find them too, but we can't do a bit of good right now. For every scary thing we saw in the daylight, I'll bet there ten times more of 'em at night.  Am I right?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I dont know.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I thought you were an expert.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Dr. Grant was.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Well Dr. Grant isn't here, so we're going to have to figure out what to do ourselves.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I just want you know, Amanda. It's not your fault what happened.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Well what?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Well damn it. I don't speak ill of the dead. What I'm trying to say is, its was just a crazy accident. The exact same thing could have happened if he was with me. You can't go beating yourself up about it.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: This wouldn't happen if he was with you. I mean, you drive five miles below the speed limit. I totaled three cars in fives years.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: That one time was just the bumper.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: He would have been, safe. Completely, entirely, suffocatingly safe.  I would have him to see more of the world than Enid, Oklahoma. I wanted to see more of the world than Enid, Oklahoma. And so yes, it's my fault that this happened. I'm sorry that you have to be here.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I'm not sorry at all.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Know what this is?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: A raptor claw. I use to have one. A fossil.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Mine's new.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: How much of this island have you explored?

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: I stayed pretty close to the compound, Figured if anyone came to look for me, that's where they'd start.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: We need to head for the coast.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Are you sure?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Closer you get to the water, the bigger things get.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: We need to stick to the plan. Head for the coast.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: What about Eric and Dr. Grant?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Going to the coast was Alan's idea. If he's alive, thats where he's headed.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: What about Eric?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Right?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: My phone.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: You had the phone the whole time?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Where is it?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I don't know. I don't have it with me.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: When did you have it last?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I don't remember

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Think.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The plane. I got a call on the plane, put it in my coat pocket, and...

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: What?...WHAT!?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I loaned it to Nash. He must have had it on him when he...

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Mon! Dad!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: You're okay.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Never had a doubt. Never did. Us Kirby men, we stick around, huh?

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: We do.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Honey, there's not enough spit in the world for that.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: We need to keep moving.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Alan, I want to tell you that I'm so sorry about the...

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Billy, I can't talk to you now.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Please, okay? Just yell at me. Call me an idiot. An asshole. Stupid. Tell me I screwed up because I know I did.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: You're no better than the people who built this place.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: We climb down to the barge and follow the river out to the ocean. With any luck, the Costa Rican coast guard will pick us up.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Then we go home?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Then we go home.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: How about if we try this way?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Do you think it goes all the way across?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: One way to find out.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Dr. Grant?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Eric, its okay. You'll be right behind me.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: We're not going anywhere, I promise.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Okay! Come on, Eric!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: How 'bout if I...

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: No, I can do it.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: That's it Eric. Nice and easy...

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Mom?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Oh, my God.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: A bird cage.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Eric!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: It won't hold!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: ERIC!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Paul! Where is he? Can you see him?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I'm trying! That thing took him down this way!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Split up!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: BILLY! WAIT!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I CAN GET HIM!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I KNOW THE CONSEQUENCES!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: ERIC! HOLD ON!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Hang on, Eric!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Let go!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: He made it!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Get back! Get back!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Billy!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: It's no use, Dr. Grant. No use.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: My own kid was right in front of me and I didn't do a damn thing.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: You couldn't have made that jump.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I should have tried. It should have been me on that beach back there, not Billy.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: How would you have helped Eric?  He needs you, Paul. He needs us.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: He could have died.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: But he didn't. And neither did you. And I'm glad about that.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Do you have any kids?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: No. Although I've studied them in the wild.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: I want to be an astronaut.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: See, I was the opposite. I never understood why anyone would want to go into space. It's so dangerous. You do one thing wrong and you're dead. The astronomer -- or the paleontologist -- get to study these amazing things from a place of complete safety. And truthfully, everything you really need to learn, you can learn it from the ground.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: But then you never get to go in space.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Exactly. The difference between imagining how things might be and seeing how they really are. To be able to touch them. That's what Billy wanted to do.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Keep quiet.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Find it before it stops ringing!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I've got something. I think I've got something!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: I've got it! I've got it!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Can't help but be a little offended.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Whatever you do, don't call the U.S. Embassy. They won't do a God Damn thing.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Well, we don't exactly have a Costa Rican phone book here, so it will have to be somebody we know in the states. Someone we can absolutely count on to send help.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Stan.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: I wouldn't trust Stan with a snowball in a blizzard.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Bonitas.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Something must've scared them.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Get the motor going.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Who are you calling?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Pick up! Pick up!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hewwo?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Charlie? Charlie. Get your mother. Right away!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hewwo?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Charlie! It's the dinosaur man! Go get mommy, okay?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Was somebody on the phone?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Dinosaur man.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: ELLIE!

Speaker: ellie
Dialogue: Alan?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Raaaar!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: PAUL!

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: DAD!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Up! Up!

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Where's Dad?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Just hold on.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Jump! Swim for the far shore!

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: We have to keep looking for Dad. We have to.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: I know. I know. I want to look for him too.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: then we should...

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Let me tell you a few things about you Dad, okay? He's very very very clever, very very brave, and he loves you ever very much.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: He loves you too.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Okay. He loves us very very much. And I know that right now more than anything, your Dad would want to know that we're safe. Okay?

Speaker: a voice
Dialogue: Listen to your mother.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Good thing I've been swimming, huh?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: You remember when we went fishing last summer? And I was trying to put the boat in and the trailer sank? And then the tow truck came and tried to pull it out, but it got dragged in? And the truck driver threatened to knock your Dad's lights out? So I said I was the governor and he believed me?

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: That was a fun day.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: We should try fishing again.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: You mean it?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: I do. It's worth another shot. And who knows? Things might turn out differently.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: The lady you called, how do you know she can help us?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: She's the one person I could always count on. And she's saved me more times than she realizes. I owe her everything.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: You should.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: You're right.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: No. I couldn't see.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: Do me a favor. Go back to your parents for a minute, would you?  They look worried.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Mom! Dad!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Helicopters. Helicopters!

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Dr. Grant! Helicopters are coming!

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: No we're not.

Speaker: a pteranodon
Dialogue: flies up out of the trees, the first of twenty. It's a gorgeous and terrifying sight.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: You have to go back! We can't leave him!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: They're not following.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: We have to cut it! Find something sharp!

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: What do you think is going to happen with the dinosaurs?

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: The population will Stabilize eventually. They'll adapt to fit different roles.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Either that, or the government will firebomb it back to the Stone Age.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: I would completely support that.

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: I hope they don't. I want to come back someday.

Speaker: grant
Dialogue: So do I.
